fields.description:
h1. create repository
h1. in your home .hgrc config, have a different username than the bitbucket username (i.e. your firstname)
h1. commit in your repository
h1. in the logs, another user is shown than you that has commit the work
quickfix  put the bitbucket username in the repository/.hg/hgrc file

I have changed computer and now when I do a push to the repository I get the following exception even though the push is successful. The changes make it to the repo but my user profile is not matched up with the checkin. Here is the error:

searching for changes\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 3 changesets with 39 changes to 35 files (-1 heads)\\
bb/acl: mspradley is allowed. accepted payload.\\
quota: 15.6 MB in use, 500.0 MB available (3.12% used)\\
error: changegroup.oberon hook raised an exception: UserProfile matching query does not exist.\\
[command completed successfully Sun Jan 31 14:00:28 2010]
fields.summary: changegroup.oberon hook raises exception after computer change

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm having some trouble reading this site (as my eyes are not that young anymore). It's the color of the fonts. Those soft-toned pastel colors make certain pages hard to read, for me at least (and maybe some others too).

Here's a list of pages I'd like to see improved : Overview, Downloads, Source, Changesets (and sub-pages).\\
Issues is ok, except if an issue contains code paste in it. Then the code-coloring is too soft too.\\
(There may be others I haven't discovered yet.)

So my request may not be top priority concerning functionality, but some means to choose more contrasting colors would be very welcome.

Johan

Hi,

We are using bitbucket to manage our real time digital archaeology project. We also have paid for one year subscription. While everything is fine and dandy when editing code, editing the wiki has been causing a lot of problems around here.

Since our wiki is also used by non-technical users(archaeologists) to review requirements, they face a lot of problems when editing a wiki page that contains images. Because of this most users went back to using word documents.

I would like to propose the following enhancements which:

* Have an alternative way to upload images. Have something on the server side that can auto-commit to the wiki when an image is added through the browser.
* Ability to attach files to the wiki pages.  This is important because if one wants to change the image and upload it, they should have the source (word file, powerpoint file etc..). (May be you can use a hidden issue for this.)
* Ability to export a wiki page to word and pdf files.

If these issues are not fixed soon, you may loose us. I hate for to move out to a chaotic world just because I can't upload an image to the wiki.

Thanks,\\
-S-

'bitbucket.org' link in blog sidebar is wrong.\\
you forgot 'http://', so it 's blog.bitbucket.org/bitbucket.org.

fields.description:
*Issue*\\
When a reader/writer forks a private repository he may "appear" to fork it as public.

*Result*\\
This will create a forked project, but it will be empty and an error message is displayed. The user may still goto the the empty project.

*Suggested Solution*\\
A reader/writer should not have permission to fork a private project as public.

A project which is private should probably not be allowed to be forked as public unless the project has been changed to public.

This error comes out when push to bitbucket pulled data from goolge code repo. This is very urgent.

http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: gokis\\
pushing to https://gokis@bitbucket.org/gokis/wowart/\\
searching for changes\\
<urlopen error (10054, 'Connection reset by peer')>

Please make some solutions

When using the ~<<toc>> command, it parses all headings. Unfortunately, it copies also the spaces between the ~==.

So "~== Foobar ==" becomes as a toc link " Foobar ".

Removing the spaces in "~==this is a heading==" results in " is a ".

The ~<<toc>>-directive does not recognize headings in the form of

~== MyHeading

I have to explicitely write

~== MyHeading ==

It would be nice if <<toc>> would see the short forms. Until now, it just generates an "=" for every heading that is written in the short form.

If I use ~<<toc>> in a wiki page and press preview, I get

Wiki macro error: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'endswith'

When I save the page and view the saved one, everything is fine.

Greetings,\\
Christoph

The title says it all.

Best regards,\\
Kirill Miazin (km@krot.org)

== Steps: ==

h1. Submit a comment on an issue with a code block (i.e., I used the 'console' lexer)
h1. Realize that you used the wrong lexer
h1. Edit the comment, changing the lexer to 'bash'
h1. Save the edit
== Expected Result: ==

The code block is formatted according to the chosen lexer.

== Actual Result ==

The code block is unformatted.
fields.summary: Code in issue comments is not highlighted after editing (BB-762)

fields.description: I'm looking at a changeset from the shortlog, and in the little code display on that page (http://bitbucket.org/applics/dnbmobile/changeset/0dc61555e531/), the html sequence & isn't escaped so it's being displayed as just &. When viewing the same code in the source browser or in the raw diff, it is correctly displayed.

If you try to login with OpenID on a CNAME, you'll be redirected to bitbucket.org at the end but you'll not be logged in on your CNAME.

The expected behavior is to be redirected to the CNAME and to be logged in.
fields.summary: Bad OpenID redirection when logging in on a CNAME (BB-761)

fields.description:
A little related to <<issue 573>> except I don't care about scrum and all the attendant complications.

Firstly milestones are currently somewhat unusable because they are sorted into ascii order when dealing with a ticket.  Entering bugs in this project is a good demonstration.  There is also a desire for some sort of summary and a longer description - again note milestones for this project.  (The summary is a pain because if you use the milestone wiki macro then you also have to get that right, and correct on any wiki pages using it.)

The trac roadmap - http://trac.edgewall.org/roadmap - is nice and suitably simple.  Each milestone has a name, summary, description and target date.  Sorting can use target date and then ascii order (although understanding numbers within would also be good).  A report like that one (including completion statistics) is then trivial to generate and gives a good project management overview.  This is important to those of us with commercial projects.  (I have a hand written wiki page trying to approximate it, but it is a pain to maintain.)

I had been using the POST body's value body['repository']['website'], which previously was 'http://bitbucket.org' -- now it is None (well, null in the JSON).  This seemed to change in the last few weeks.

For my repository Hear a Blog (http://bitbucket.org/pupeno/hearablog), I'm submitting as pablo@hearablog.com instead of as pupeno@pupeno.com which is my address at bitbucket.

The avatar is not shown. Not even the gravatar which I have set for that email address: http://www.gravatar.com/avatar/04d1e21543a69f3986801c9cf56b2ca5.png

From a change, can you link to FogBugz's bug report when BugzID is present?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Can you link to FogBugz when ID is present

fields.description:
If you setup "email diff" with a private/paid for repository then you get an email with a mime type of text/plain, the body of the email containing a huge amount of HTML and buried somewhere in the middle of that the text "Error You do not have access to this repository".

I'm an admin for the repository so obviously have access.  Presumably the cause is how you have the email diff service wired up.
fields.summary: "email diff" service with private repository gives bogus mail

fields.description:
I have a page like this:

{{{\\
<<toc>>

== Milestones ==

blah blah

=== 0 ===

blah blah

<<milestone 0>>

=== 1 ===

blah blah

<<milestone 1>>\\
}}}

It goes all the way to 4 plus another two.  Riveting stuff.  Anyway the TOC\\
macro completely messes up.  Sections where the milestone list is empty show\\
up ok in the toc, but if there are any matching tickets then they get\\
expanded into the toc too in a mangled form making an awful mess.

An example page is in a private repository.
fields.summary: toc on page with milestones results in mess

fields.description:
I sent two problem reports to support@bitbucket.org in December like the help page says I can.  I never received any form of human or automated response.

If you ignore the mail then don't have it on the help page.

If you have a spam filter then at least add an automated response and on the help page say so.  That way not getting the response is an indication that the mail got filtered out.

If the latter is what happened then your spam filter sucks and dumped my perfectly good requests and did it after receipt rather than during SMTP when I would have been notified about it.

I have two accounts on bitbucket.  One is my own personal one for my own open source stuff.  The second is for work where I then have access to a paid for repository.

I had to associate a SSH rsa key with one account and dss key with the other (you won't allow the same SSH key for different accounts).  Unfortunately bitbucket gets confused since it appears to guess my user based on what ssh tried to negotiate since the username is always 'hg' but SSH seems to pick keys in a random order.

Please can you let me specify my account name in the SSH URL instead of 'hg' which will make all these kind of issues go away.

If you won't do that then at least please put who you think I am in error messages.  Below is an example of an error I am currently getting, but I can't tell who bitbucket thinks I am - it just says "You're":

{{{\\
$ hg push ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/rogerbinns/couchsize/\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/rogerbinns/couchsize/\\
searching for changes\\
remote: adding changesets\\
remote: adding manifests\\
remote: adding file changes\\
remote: added 1 changesets with 1 changes to 1 files\\
remote: error: pretxnchangegroup.bb_perm hook failed: You're not allowed to write to this repository.\\
remote: transaction abort!\\
remote: rollback completed\\
remote: abort: You're not allowed to write to this repository.\\
abort: unexpected response: empty string\\
}}}

I just tried creating a new repository for an upcoming site that's under HTTP Basic authentication while under development and the validation routine came back saying "This URL appears to be a broken link." I just checked with cURL and the server is responding with: HTTP/1.1 401 Authorization Required as expected.

Not a biggy as I just removed the URL, but it feels a bit wrong.
fields.summary: URL validation doesn't account for 401 response

fields.description:
http://bitbucket.org/k4ml/pulut2 displayed wrong author name even though I was prompted for usename/password when pushing it. And I'm quite sure I have entered my own username and password.

FYI, I've created another account (the wrong one - bytecraft) prior to that for office use. I've then decided to just use my own personal account.

When trying to clone or push via https, after typing my password I receive following error:\\
{{{\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: tataata\\
abort: authorization failed\\
[command interrupted]\\
}}}

This is an error I receive from TortoiseHG on Windows 7, while trying to push. If I am trying to clone on my VPS (Ubuntu 9.04) I get the following:\\
{{{\\
interrupted: authorization failed\\
}}}

I thought that maybe my password is wrong, so I changed it on the website. I can login to the website with new password, but https authorization still fails.

Please help.

Thanks in advance.

Is there anyway I can fix this?
On http://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/ there's no documentation of methods! Something broken?
we would like to see the site in Tamil. If you give me the .po file, I would be glad to do the translation - no strings attached.

(Thank you so much for BitBucket. It's a great place. I love the integrated simple issue tracker.)

In issue tracker, when I click on the "Open" filter, I'd like to only see issues that have been opened instead of status= "Open" or "New".

i.e. I'd like "New" issues hidden in the open view.

I put this as a proposal and not a bug because it may just be my idiosyncratic way of looking at issues. I like ths simple categories and flow:

New - things people have reported that I haven't triaged yet.\\
Open - things being worked on now, should be a focused list\\
Hold - Things postponed.
fields.summary: Would like "Open" filter to NOT include "New" items.

fields.description:
It would be very cool if I can move tickets over to another repository.

See for example you have a main branch of your project and someone creates a new fork to add some cool new features.  Now a user reports a bug regarding that new repository while that bug exists in the main branch too. This is obviously wrong and should be moved to the main repository since the aim of that fork is just not fixing annoying bugs.

There are plenty other examples I miss right now but that feature would be very cool!
fields.summary: Allow moving individual tickets over to another repository (BB-759)

fields.description: If you access http://bitbucket.org/plans/ with IE7, the "Sign Up" image is not clickable as with other browsers.
fields.summary: "Sign up" image not a link in IE7

fields.description:
Bug tracker menu has a "mine" entry, e.g.:\\
http://bitbucket.org/max/vse-sto/issues/mine/

It displays ALL issues, including already resolved. Most of the time I need to look at list of my OPEN issues.
fields.summary: bug tracker: quick link to mine's OPEN issues (BB-660)

fields.description:
See the link set by Andreas on this issue: http://hg.bpython-interpreter.org/bpython/issue/70/shift-tab-should-cycle-backwards-in-completion

When I click it it sends me to hostname/username/etc but with the cname the username is unnecessary.
fields.summary: Link to revision does not work on CNAME domain (BB-685)

fields.description:
Everytime I look at the source viewer I feel compelled to read the right column, but it's almost never really useful.  In the timeline it's sensible, but not in the source view.

When I'm looking at the source listing, I usually want to get an overview of the files.  For Python files at least, that would be the first line of the docstring.  For other languages, I don't know.
fields.summary: Last change message is not that useful in source listing

fields.description:
I have a bunch of repositories now, and I have them all configured similarly -- an email service, a Twitter service, maybe at some point a CIA service.  Managing these is really annoying, though, because of the shear number.  For instance, I'd like to configure my Twitter services to use ${commit.tinyurl}, but editing each one is a pain.

If there was an API (ideally with a command-line script to run the API) to configure services that'd be very helpful.

It feels weird sometimes that just because I create a repository, the name of the repository has /ianb/ in it, even though I might not be the primary contributor, or feel a sense of authorship/ownership.

It would be nice if there was the concept of groups, and a group could own a repository.  Everyone in the group would have write access to all repositories owned by the group.

I can't delete repository completely\\
please, delete it http://bitbucket.org/iav/weave1.0/

I filed an issue about this before -- previously http://sjl.bitbucket.org/hg-prompt would not work but http://sjl.bitbucket.org/hg-prompt/ would.

Now both of the URLs work, but when you go to http://sjl.bitbucket.org/hg-prompt a trailing slash isn't appended.  This means any relative links on the page will break.

For example, go to http://sjl.bitbucket.org/hg-prompt and click on one of the links.  It will be a 404.  Now go to http://sjl.bitbucket.org/hg-prompt/ and click a link -- it will work.
fields.summary: Bitbucket pages don't append a trailing slash (BB-758)

fields.description:
Hey there!

I have just a private repository and like to get notified about changes and get the proper diffs.

That's yet possible but broken.  If I get a notification about a new commit I get a permission denied error.  Since there can only be "trusted" users on private repositories such a permission check is a bit too much.

Would be cool to get some readable notifications soon for my repository :)

Regards,\\
Christopher

I must say, I do like the patch queue support in Bitbucket. Except for one thing, though: often, when I try to apply a patch queue, I get an error 500 — internal server error. When you link to something at the bottom of a file (e.g., http://bitbucket.org/ianb/pip/src/tip/docs/requirement-format.txt#cl-105 ) the screen can't scroll down that far, so the linked line isn't actually at the top of the screen.

There's a CSS pseudo class you can use for this (:target, I think), and then highlight that line to make it clearer.  Sphinx might actually use Javascript to implement this even on other browsers, so there might be code to take from there.
fields.summary: Highlight target fragment in source view

fields.description:
Repro: Force-push multiple heads to the wiki repository.  Then, try to edit the wiki from the website.

Error: A "500 Internal Server Error" page gets thrown up.  This doesn't give any feedback about the cause of the problem or how to fix it.  Merging the heads (offline) and pushing that resolves the problem. (First encountered with the repository '/aysz88/mortus'.)\\
The displayed content also seemed to be unpredictable/unexpected to the viewers of the wiki, though I wasn't paying attention to that myself.

The quick fix is probably to detect this condition and put up a more informative error message alerting both writers and readers of the condition.  I don't know what the 'Right Thing' would be (should it be resolvable from the site? is something already expected to happen instead?).
fields.summary: Uninformative 500 server error when trying to edit wiki that has multiple heads (BB-756)

fields.description: Probably more related to webfaction actually, nonetheless - I have two email identities at the moment: 'admin@...' and 'lydia@...' but it's basically just admin. I can't send from lydia, though I can receive. Apparently it could/should be set up in a different way whereby I login in my own name, and then admin is linked to there. In this way, in the future if there's another administrator emails can be directed to them without unnecessary overlapping of personal emails. Not sure if this makes sense and how easy it would be to rearrange, but a thought where improvement would be welcome.

{{{\\
C:\thg-winbuild>hg.exe push --debug\\
using https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg-winbuild\\
http auth: user sborho, password ********\\
sending between command\\
pushing to https://sborho:***@bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg-winbuild\\
sending capabilities command\\
capabilities: unbundle=HG10GZ,HG10BZ,HG10UN branchmap lookup changegroupsubset\\
sending heads command\\
searching for changes\\
common changesets up to c7dd88b87844\\
sending branchmap command\\
1 changesets found\\
list of changesets:\\
84d1e6ddd06cb79f5e43dac05a7527fc158b46b8\\
sending unbundle command\\
sending 370 bytes\\
abort: HTTP Error 405: Method Not Allowed\\
}}}

If I turn around and use the 1.4 release build, installed as Python source on the same machine, the push succeeds.

{{{\\
C:\thg-winbuild>hg push --debug\\
using https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg-winbuild\\
http auth: user sborho, password ********\\
sending between command\\
real URL is https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg-winbuild/\\
pushing to https://sborho:***@bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg-winbuild\\
sending capabilities command\\
capabilities: unbundle=HG10GZ,HG10BZ,HG10UN branchmap lookup changegroupsubset\\
sending heads command\\
searching for changes\\
common changesets up to c7dd88b87844\\
sending branchmap command\\
1 changesets found\\
list of changesets:\\
84d1e6ddd06cb79f5e43dac05a7527fc158b46b8\\
sending unbundle command\\
sending 370 bytes\\
http auth: user sborho, password ********\\
adding changesets\\
adding manifests\\
adding file changes\\
added 1 changesets with 1 changes to 1 files\\
bb/acl: sborho is allowed. accepted payload.\\
quota: 171.3 MB in use, 150.0 MB available (114.20% used)\\
}}}
fields.summary: abort: HTTP Error 405: Method not allowed

fields.description:
To get e-mail notifications when any page on the wiki changes.

Maybe this is a checkbox in the repo admin:\\
[x] Send wiki changes to repo followers.
fields.summary: Let users subscribe to (follow) wiki changes (BB-709)

fields.description:
Hi,

I own the following domain name: 'nichol.as', however bitbucket complains that it is not a valid domain name when I try to set it in the admin page.

Kind regards,\\
Nicholas

Hey,

I know I am a little strange to be using a white text on dark bg theme on my machine, but still the site looks bad with that kind of setting. You need to set background and color explicitly.

http://sjl.bitbucket.org/hg-prompt is a 404, but http://sjl.bitbucket.org/hg-prompt/ works.

Appending trailing slashes would make the user page URLs much less fragile.
fields.summary: Trailing slashes aren't appended for user page URLs.

fields.description:
I created a new Hg projected at home and used the username tstone to check in some changes.  Later, I uploaded the repository to bitbucket.  When doing so, I had to create a user account (tstone2077).  When I uploaded, it says that bitbucket's user tstone had contributed to the project.

The example of this can be found at http://bitbucket.org/tstone2077/svnautomaticgatekeeper./\\
tstone (my pre-bitbucket account) created the first 3 revisions.

This file contains an include to postgre.h but it has to be postgres_ext.h and an include to catalog/pg_type.h but it has to be  pg_type.h (without catalog)

roco3d@gmail.com

{{{\\
#!python\\
** Please report this bug to http://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/stable/issues or tortoisehg-discuss@lists.sourceforge.net\\
** Mercurial version (1.4).  TortoiseHg version (0.9)\\
** Command: --nofork log\\
** CWD: E:\ExportTest\CheckedOut\SaveStateChange\\
** Extensions loaded: extdiff\\
Recoverable runtime error (stderr):\\
Traceback (most recent call last):\\
File "tortoisehg\hgtk\history.pyo", line 136, in navigate\\
File "tortoisehg\hgtk\history.pyo", line 1509, in goto_rev\\
File "tortoisehg\hgtk\logview\treeview.pyo", line 332, in set_revision_id\\
AttributeError: 'TreeView' object has no attribute 'index'

}}}
Something has widened the bitbucket pages. It's infuriating!!! A lot is now unreadable for me.

I love the changeset view and the possibility to link directly to lines.  But it's kinda annoying scrolling up and down and after that not finding the line you were reffered to.

To ease the life of a changeset reviewer it would be cool to highlight the target changeset line.

For very simple things it's just some CSS:

:target {\\
border: 1px dotted;\\
}

I don't matter what style you choose but I hope you integrate something like that.

Thanks!

Regards,\\
Christopher
I see it does change the code color when viewing a file, but the changesets seem to be stuck on Trac coloring.
fields.summary: Changing highlight style doesn't affect changeset snippet code

fields.description: The small type in the source view combined with gray on white is nearly impossible to read.

I'm running the latest snapshot release from the site and get a SIGABRT at the following line in ZKCDTrailer.m:

bq. bq. line 53\\
commentLength = [self.comment zk_precomposedUTF8Length];



The same code will run in the simulator though.

I'm running iPhone OS 3.0 and 3.1.

Thanks.
fields.summary: ZipKit Touch Demo won't run on device

fields.description:
It's not important at all, but the message you get when you view a repository while it's being deleted says the following:

=== Cloning! ===\\
We're cloning your repository right now, and it shouldn't take long.

This page will reload itself continuously until it's done.
fields.summary: Viewing a repository while it's being deleted gives "we're cloning"

For example, in http://bitbucket.org/ned/coveragepy/changeset/ee491a08fa05/#chg-coverage/htmlfiles/pyfile.html, line 46 contains:   but looks like it is:
fields.summary: Source code with ampersands isn't escaped properly in diffs.

fields.description:
I have had an issue with some, but not all, snapshots received from other users opening as size 0 x 0. The image continues to remain zero sized perpetually no matter how many times closed and reopened. But after restarting the viewer, the snapshots open normally.

This appears to be an issue with snapshots only and not other textures.

Snowglobe 1.1.3 (2906) Oct 16 2009 11:21:13 (Snowglobe Release)\\
